Background Warfarin is effective in preventing recurrent venous thromboembolism but is also associated with a risk of bleeding. In this study, the warferin initiation and maintenance nomograms for PTE patients under different clinic setting were observed. Methods 79 patients with confirmed acute PTE were assigned to accompanying with chronic diseases or organ dysfunction (the first group), or accompanying with a chronic disease but without organs dysfunction (the second group), or no any chronic diseases (the third group). Then the subgroups were assigned by the initial warfarine to either 2.5 mg or 5 mg. The initiated doses, the time to achieve a therapeutic international normalized ratio (INR), the proportion of patients whose INRs exceeded the therapeutic range, and the maintenance doses were analyzed prospectively.
body_text.section: Results

body_text.text: Results By using 2.5 mg initial warfarine, the proportion of patients achieved a therapeutic INR by the 5th day of treatment were 82.35%, 42.83% and 0 in the first, second and third groups. The time to achieve a therapeutic INR in the third group was longer than the first one, but was no difference compared to the second group. By using 5 mg warfarine, the proportion of patients achieved a therapeutic INR were all 100% among three groups, and a therapeutic INR was all exceeded in the first group. Maintaining and total doses needed to be achieved therapeutic INRs were lower in the first group than either second or third group. The proportion of patients whose INRs exceeded the therapeutic range was higher in the second than the third groups. Conclusions 1) in the patients accompanying with chronic diseases or organs dysfunction, the initial and maintaining dosage of warfarine with ~2.5 mg and ~2 mg could be more safe. 2) in the patients accompanying with a chronic disease without organs dysfunction, the initial dosage with 5 mg could be chosen but reduced afterwards; 3) the initial and maintain dosage with ~5 mg and ~3.75 mg could be suitable in the patients no accompanying with any chronic disease. Background Hypoxia may enhance the generation of free radicals in skeletal muscle, which may in turn affect contractility. In this study, we determined the effect of hypoxia on diaphragm muscle peroxynitrite (ONOO) formation under resting conditions and after fatiguing contractions. Methods Rat diaphragm muscle strips were dissected and mounted in tissue baths under hypoxic (PO 2~ 6.5 kPa) or hyperoxic (PO 2~ 88 kPa) conditions (60 cin). Force frequency relationship was determined. Subsequently, muscle nitrotyrosine formation was assessed as a measure of ONOO formation. In addition, the effects of fatiguing isotonic contractions were determined on nitrotyrosine formation under hypoxic and hyperoxic conditions (60 min). Results Hypoxia depressed force frequency relationship (P < 0.001 vs. hyperoxia). Nitrotyrosine optical density of protein bands already present under hyperoxic conditions was significantly enhanced by hypoxia. Also, additional protein bands were detected during hypoxia at 295 and 243 kDa. Fatigue endurance was reduced under hypoxic conditions (P < 0.05 vs. hyperoxia). Fatiguing contractions increased nitrotyrosine formation under hyperoxic conditions (P < 0.05 vs. rest), but not under hypoxic conditions (P > 0.05 vs. rest).

PHARMACOKINETIC STUDIES ON IRINOTECAN IN PATIENTS WITH THORACIC MALIGNANT TUMOR AND RENAL DYSFUNCTION SHIGERU MIYATA, TAKASHI NAKANO, TAKU OKUKUBO, AKI MURAKAMI, KOZO KURIBAYASHI, SHINICHIRO IIDA, SEIICHI NOBUYAMA, MITSUTOMI MIYAKE, HITOSHI NAKAMURA Division of Respiratory Medicine, Department of Internal Medicine, Hyogo College of Medicine, Nishinomiya, JapanBackgrond Irinotecan hydrochloride (CPT-11), is a potent inhibitor of Topo-I activity. CPT-11 is converted into its active metabolite, 7-ethyl-10hydroxycamptothecin (SN-38), by carboxylesterase found in the plasma, the intestinal mucosa and the liver. SN-38 is further metabolized by UDP glucuronosyltransferase 1A1 (UGT1A1) to its inactive form, SN-38 glucuronide (SN-38-Glu), and subsequently secreted into the intestine via bile. Recently the number of patients with renal dysfunction is increasing. The medication method of CPT-11 in patients with renal dysfunction is not established. We examined pharmacokinetics of CPT-11 in patients with thoracic malignant tumor and renal dysfunction. Method Plasma samples were collected at 1, 2, 4, 12 and 24 hours after the infusion of CPT-11 (40 mg/m 2 ) in 2 patients. Result The maximum concentration (Cmax) of CPT-11 and SN38 in plasma was reached between 0 and 2 hours from the onset of infusion. Cmax of SN38G in plasma was reached between 4 and 12 hours from the onset of infusion. Pharmacokinetic profiles of CPT-11, SN38 and SN38G in plasma at a dose of 40 mg/m 2 in patients with renal dysfunction were approximately equivalent to those at a dose of 50 mg/m 2 in patients with normal renal function. FIGREF14.text: KONISHI, M MAEMONDO, T SUZUKI, A INOUE, Y SAIJO, T NUKIWA Respiratory Oncology and Molecular Medicine, Institute for Development, Aging, Cancer, Tohoku University, Japan Background Metastasis in mediastinal lymph nodes is critical in deciding whether the treatment of a patient can be done surgically alone or requires additional chemotherapy and/or irradiation. Current diagnostic criteria of positive mediastinal lymph node metastasis in CT images is defined as the lymph node over 1 cm in diameter. After the introduction of FDG-PET in our institute, some lymph nodes with diameters under 1 cm appeared with increased amount of standardized unit volume (SUV) in pet images. We retrospectively examined the size of mediastinal lymph nodes in CT images among patients with positive level of FDG-PET, and analyzed the sensitivity of FDG-PET. Study population and results Fifteen patients had increased level of SUV in mediastinal region among 78 cases of NSCLC examined by FDG-PET (Oct, 2003 to May, 2004). Seven (47%) of these appeared as negative metastasis in CT images (lymph node size under 1 cm in diameter). Conclusions FDG-PET could be useful in finding small metastasis of mediastinal lymph nodes. The obvious discrepancy in the positivity of FDG-PET and lymph node size in CT images poses the need for investigation on the criteria of the mediastinal lymph node metastasis.

The aim of this study was to evaluate differences in clinical characteristics and outcome among culture positive and culture negative miliary TB patients from Pakistan, a high TB burden country. Methods All adult patients with miliary TB, admitted between 1994 and 2001, were identified using a computerized database. These patients were divided into culture positive and culture negative groups and their clinical characteristics, lab investigations and outcome were recorded and compared. SPSS version 10 was used for statistical analysis. Results Of 110 patients diagnosed with miliary TB, 32 (30%) patients were culture positive. The most frequent sources of positive cultures were sputum (37%), cerebrospinal fluid (18%) and lymph nodes (12%). Half of the patients in both groups were between 30 and 60 years of age. There was female predominance (60%) in culture negative patients. Smoking was more common among culture positive patients (P = 0.02). Majority of clinical features, comorbidities and lab investigations were similar in both groups except the culture positive miliary TB patients were more anorexic (P = 0.013) and breathless (P = 0.05) at presentation and their chest radiographs showed more fibrosis (P = 0.009). There was no significant difference in complications (P = 0.50), and mortality (P = 0.38) in both groups. Conclusion There was no significant difference in clinical characteristics, comorbidities, lab investigations and outcome between culture positive and culture negative miliary TB patients. REGULATION OF CYTOKINE-AND PHORBOL ESTER-MEDIATED INTERLEUKIN (IL)-8 EXPRESSION IN THE ABSENCE OR PRESENCE OF PYOCYANIN IN HUMAN BRONCHIAL EPITHELIAL CELL LINE: ROLES OF PROTEIN KINASE C AND MITOGEN-ACTIVATED PROTEIN KINASES WS HUI 1 , GL TIPOE 2 , KWT TSANG 1 , JCW MAK 1 Departments of 1 Medicine, 2 Anatomy, The University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, China Airway epithelial cells are among the first targets of environmental stimuli and local cytokine, in response to which they can produce IL-8. Pyocyanin, a blue phenazine pigment produced by Pseudomonas aeruginosa, has been shown to synergise with IL-1 and tumour necrosis factor (TNF) in triggering IL-8 release. Mechanisms regulating the synergising effects are minimally understood. We hypothesized that the potentiation of IL-8 release in airway epithelial cells would result from activation of protein kinase C (PKC) and subsequent activation of the specific mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) pathways, so we investigated signal transduction pathways in human bronchial epithelial cell line (BEAS-2B). IL-1b and phorbol 12,13dibutyrate (PDBu) induced the release of IL-8 in BEAS-2B. Pyocyanin alone caused no release of IL-8 but potentiated IL-1b-and PDBu-mediated IL-8 release. The stimulation of IL-8 in the presence of pyocyanin plus PDBu or IL-1b required activation of PKC [inhibition by Go 6976 (an selective inhibitor of classic PKC isoforms)]. Go 6976 (100 mM) inhibited PDBu-stimulated IL-8 release in the presence of pyocyanin profoundly (1.35 ± 0.32% maximal response; n = 3; P < 0.001). U0126 (a potent and specific inhibitor of MEK-1/MEK-2), and SB203580 (a selective inhibitor of p38 MAPK) showed profound inhibition on IL-1b-and PDBu-mediated IL-8 release in the presence of pyocyanin but SP600125 (a novel selective JNK inhibitor; 10 mM) failed to inhibit PDBu-mediated IL-8 release in the presence of pyocyanin. The data demonstrate regulation of IL-8 release by PKC pathways converging on the specific MAPK pathways in the local airway responses. (Supported by Hong Kong RGC CERG award 2003-2004.)

Conclusion The measurements of Dm and Vc are sensitive tests to find the impaired of lung diffusion capacity in patients with COPD, espesialy in early stage COPD.EFFECTS OF LONG-TERM OXYGEN THERAPY ON SURVIVAL AND EVALUATION OF SURVIVAL PREDICTORS FOR PATIENTS SUFFERING FROM CHRONIC OBSTRUCTIVE PULMONARY DISEASEBackground Data on survival of COPD patients in Asia Pacific Region is scarce. The current study is a retrospective cohort survival analysis of patients suffering from COPD requiring Long Term Oxygen Therapy (LTOT) admitted and/or followed up in Respiratory Medical Department, Kowloon Hospital from 1993 to 1999. Methods Case notes of COPD patients put on LTOT between 1993 & 1999 were reviewed. Kaplan-Meier for survival analysis and Cox-regression for survival predictors analysis were performed. The survival status of these patients was confirmed through review of Clinical Management System of the Hospital Authority and the Death Registry of Hong Kong. Results 455 COPD patients put on LTOT from 1993 to 1999 were identified from a database system of Occupational Therapy Department of Kowloon Hospital. 225 patients were excluded for reasons of co-existing lung diseases or other comorbidies that affect survival, short duration of LTOT and non-fulfillment of LTOT prescription criteria. The remaining 230 patients were analysed for survival versus time. The mean age of the cohort is 70 ± 8.4. Their mean % of predicted FEV 1 was 27 ± 10. A total of 139 subjects were identified dead on the censored date on 31 December 2001. The median survival time for our COPD patients on LTOT was 41 months. The survival rates were 88% at the 1 st year, 68% at the 2 nd year, 56% for the 3 rd year, 41% for the 4 th year and 29% for the 5 th year. Gender, age and ADL independence level had significant impact in survival based on Kaplan-Meier analysis: female patients had longer survival than male patients, patients aged <70 and those with higher ADL independence level had better survival. Multivariate analysis with Cox regression revealed that age, gender and ADL independence level were the only survival predictors after adjusting for other potential variables including FEV 1 , % predicted FEV 1 , FVC, FEV 1 /FVC, PaO 2 , PaCO 2 , smoking pack year and prescribed oxygen flow rate. Younger female patients with higher degree of independence in ADL had longer survival. Besides young age and female sex, a higher degree of independence in daily living is associated with a longer survival. Further multi-centered study is recommended to confirm the findings. TABREF40.text: Introduction Lung cancer, mainly consists of non-small cell carcinoma (NSCLC), has become an epidemic in the past few decades. Recent data have suggested an important role of antioxidants and reactive oxygen species in lung carcinogenesis. However, the exact antioxidant profiles in subjects with NSCLC are lacking. We have conducted a study of the systemic antioxidant activities in red blood cell lysate from subjects with NSCLC and healthy control subjects. Method Antioxidants (catalase, superoxide dismutase [SOD], and glutathione peroxidase [GPx]) were measured using chemical kinetic reactions under spectrophotometry as previously described.1 Results There were 189 cases of mostly advanced stage IIIB or IV NSCLC (67% males, 57.0 ± 11.7 years, 56% ever-smoked, 56% adenocarcinoma) and 202 healthy controls (59% males, 49.5 ± 15.6 years, 39% ever-smoked) being studied. In subjects with lung cancer, there were higher catalase activity (32.6 ± 4.3 vs 23.5 ± 0.9 mU/g haemoglobin (Hb), P = 0.03), lower SOD activity (26.4 ± 2.4 vs 55 ± 2.5 U/gHb, P < 0.001), and higher GPx activity (227.3 ± 12.4 vs 50.8 ± 1.1 mU/gHb, P < 0.001) compared with controls. The antioxidant activities in lung cancer subjects were not associated with age, gender, smoking status, or tumour cell types. However, more advanced disease (stage IV compared to IIIB) was associated with lower SOD activity (21.8 ± 2.5 vs 37.0 ± 5.7 U/gHb respectively, P = 0.03). Using multivariate analysis, the presence of lung cancer independently predicts catalase, SOD, and GPx activities.ConclusionNSCLC in Chinese is associated with alterations in systemic antioxidant activities, which may play an important role in carcinogenesis. Methods Between February 2002 and June 2004, Video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS) was performed for 20 patients with 24 lesions less than or equal to 3 cm in diameter. Preoperative CT guided bronchoscopic marking using Barium sulfate was performed several days before VATS. Wedge resection with fluoroscopy-guided VATS was performed as primary therapy. Results Single lesions were identified in 17 patients, and multiple lesions (range 2 to 3) were in three cases. One patient with multiple lesions displayed bilateral diseases. All patients were asymptomatic, and detected on CT screening. Pathologic diagnoses for 24 lesions were as follows: Atypical adenomatous hyperplasia (AAH) in 3 cases, Locarized bronchioloalveolar carcinoma (LBAC) in 19 cases, and organizing pneumonia or inflammatoric changes in 2 cases. Vascular permeation was not found in all LBACs. However, the pleural indentation was existed in 2 cases, those are more than or equal to 2 cm in diameter. Conclusions VATS limited resection for small GGO on CT may be adequate for managing patients displaying small GGOs, especially less than or equal to 2 cm in diameter.ADIkBa TRANSFER REVERSES THE CHEMORESISTANCE TO TAXOL BY INDUCING APOPTOSIS IN NUDE MICE WITH HUMANLUNG CANCER J NI 1 , K TAKAYAMA 2 , N INOSHIMA 2 , T HARADA 2 , T MINAMI 2 , CC ZHOU 1 , Y NAKANISHI 2 1 Department of Oncology, Shanghai Pneumology Hospital, PRC, 2 Research Institute for Diseases of the Chest, Faculty of Medicine, Kyushu University, JapanBackground For most of patients with lung cancer, chemotherapy is the main choice for management. But the dose-related toxicity of chemotherapy agents and chemoresistance result in the ultimate treatment failure. One of the mechanism of chemoresistance is resistance of the tumor to apoptosis. Activated NFkB (Nuclear Factor kB) takes potent role in cell survival through modulating cell-cycle and inhibiting the apoptosis, thus results in resistance to treatment. Objective To investigate the combinated effect of AdIkBa(adenovirus expressed inhibitor kBa, IkBa, the inhibitor of NFkB) transfer and chemotherapy on the human lung cancer cell line H460 in vitro and in vivo. Methods In cultivated cells, 50% of inhibitory concentrations (IC50) of chemotherapy agents were detected singly or combined with AdIkBa trsnsfer. Annexin-V/PI stain and caspase 3 activity measurement were completed to detect the apoptosis caused by treatment. For established tumor, the effect of combination treatment was evaluated. The interaction of NFkB and p53 and that between NFkB and VEGF were analyzed. Results Part of chemotherapy agents we used, including of paclitaxel (taxol) showed significantly decreased IC50 when combined with AdIkBa in cultivated cells?. Annexin V/PI detection showed more apoptotic cells in this system by activating caspase 3 pathway but not related with TNFa secretion. In sub-treated dose, the combinated treatment showed more effective. For established H460 tumors, combinated treatment significantly inhibited tumor growth. Immunohistochemical stain proved increased expression of p65 after taxol single treatment while combination with AdIkBa intratumoral injection eliminated this expression accompanied with the slightly decreased expression of VEGF and stable p53 status. Conclusion Combination of chemotherapy and IkBa could inhibit the tumor growth effectively by blocking the expression of NFkB and inducing apoptosis. It may be simultaneously bate the expression of VEGF but independent of p53. Also, it might reduce the dose of chemotherapy agents and benefit for clinical application.

TABREF45.text: Background To determine the efficacy and toxicity of CPT-11 and CDDP with TRT, we conducted a phase II study in patients with NSCLC. Methods Fifty patients fulfilling the following eligibility criteria were enrolled: chemotherapy-naive, good performance status (PS: 0-1), age < 75, stage III, and adequate hematological, hepatic and renal function. Patients' characteristics were as follows: male/female = 40/10; PS 0/1 = 16/34; median age (range) = 62 (41-74); Ad/Sq/Large/Others = 30/16/2/2; stage IIIA/IIIB = 11/39. Based on the phase I study (Eur J Cancer 37:1359, 2001), the patients received CPT-11 60 mg/m 2 i.v. on days 1, 8 and 15, and CDDP 80 mg/m 2 i.v. on day 1 of every 4 weeks. Radiotherapy of 2 Gy/day commenced on day 2 of each chemotherapy cycle, with 28 Gy and 32 Gy administered for the first and second cycle, respectively. Results After 17 pts enrolled, chemotherapy dose were reduced CPT-11 50 mg/m 2 and CDDP 60 mg/m 2 because of low therapy completion rate. Forty-eight patients were assessable for response, toxicity and survival. Forty patients achieved a partial response (PR), 7 showed stable disease (SD), and 1 showed progressive disease (PD). The overall response rate was 83.3% (95%CI, 70.4-91.3%). The rate was 87.5% in 50/60 dose. Grade 4 leukopenia, neutropenia and thrombocytopenia occurred in 21%, 48% and 2%, respectively. Grade 3 or 4 diarrhea, pneumonitis, esophagitis and fatigue occurred 19%, 10%, 10% and 19%, respectively. Treatment-related death occurred in one patient who suffered late pneumonitis. The median survival time was 25.1 months, and the 1-, 2-, and 3-year survival rates were 72.6%, 50.9% and 39.2%, respectively. Conclusion The combination of CPT-11/CDDP with concurrent split-course TRT is well tolerated with a high activity in patients with locally advanced NSCLC.A STUDY OF INHIBITORY EFFECT OF HTERT DNAZYME ON A549/DDP CELL GROWTHBINGXIANG YU, YOUNING LIU, XIAOFEI ZHENGDept. of Respitratory Medicine, Chinese PLA General Hospital, Beijing, ChinaObjective This study analyzed the relationship between telomerase activity and drug resistance in A549/DDP cell. TABREF84.text: XIU-YUN HE, YU-HUI ZHUANG, GUO-LI LI, XIAO-GANG ZHANG Tuberculosis Laboratory, the 309th Hospital, PLA, China Background Pyrazinamide (PZA) is first-line drugs used to treat tuberculosis. PZA is precursor that must be converted to pyrazinoic acid by the pyrazinamidase. Pyranamidase lose activity that is relate to PZA resistance, so pyrazinamidase gene (pncA) mutation is thought to accord with pyrazinamidase losing activity. But many clinical isolates from China did not find pncA mutation. Methods The tested Mycobacterium tuberculosis was isolated and its PZA drug susceptibility testing were performed with absolute concentration. The pncA gene was sequenced besides 80 bp of upstream sequence and 35 bp of downstream sequence. Results 76.5% (13/17) PZA-susceptible isolates lacked mutations. The point mutations of pncA gene mainly resulted in nonsense mutation in PZA-susceptible isolates. The pncA gene mutation was identified in 5 of 26 (19.2%) PZA-resistant isolates, and the upstream sequence mutation was identified in 3 of 26 (11.5%) PZA-resistant isolates, and the simultaneous mutation of pncA and its upstream sequence was identified in 6 of 26 (23.1%) PZA-resistant isolates. while 12 (46.2%) PZA-resistant isolates lacked mutations (Table 1). The point mutations of pncA gene resulted in an amino acid substitution, or insertion and deletion mutations of pncA resulted in frame shift. the upstream sequence mutation were deletion, insertion and point mutation. Conclusion pncA gene and its upstream sequence mutation is among molecular mechanism of PZA resistance in Mycobacterium tuberculosis isolated from China. It is suspected that other gene locus relate to of PZA resistance in clinical isolates from China.AN APPROACH TO RAPIDLY DIAGNOSE AND DETECT RIFAMPICIN RESISTANCE IN MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS BASED ON PHAGE-AMPLIFIED BIOLOGICAL ASSAYLI PENG 1 , YONG-AI LUO 1 , GUO-ZHI WANG 2 * 1 Department of Pulmonary, The First Affiliated Hospital of Chongqing University of Medical Sciences, Chongqing, China; 2 Division of Bacteria Vaccine, National Institute for The Control of Pharmaceutical and Biological Products, Beijing, ChinaBackground Rapid diagnosis and drug susceptibility test of M. tuberculosis is essential to initiate timely and appropriate treatment to curb the spread of TB, which is a potentially life threatening disease. Increase in multidrug resistant M. tuberculosis (MDR-TB) has become a great cause of concern and rifampicin resistance is considered to be a good predictor of MDR-TB. Detection of rifampicin resistance by PhaB (phage-amplified biologically) assay is a useful tool as mycobacteriophage is specific for M. tuberculosis complex and detect viable cells only. The purpose of this study was to evaluate the assay's utilization in diagnosis and detection on rifampicin resistance in M. tuberculosis. Methods The condition of PhaB assay, including various infection times prior to addition of virucide and the effect of the inactivation agents which could inactive the extracellular phages were investigated. We evaluated the clinical utility of this new assay by analyzing 78 specimens including 52 M tuberculosis complex, 19 Non-M. Tuberculosis (NTM) and 7 common bacteria in respiratory system. The sensitivity, specificity and accuracy of PhaB assay were tested when it was used in rapid diagnosis of tuberculosis. Some important agents of the method, including mycobacteriophage, virucide and help cells, were investigated at different time when they were preserved at 4°C. Furthermore, 52 M tuberculosis isolates were tested the susceptibility to rifampicin by the PhaB assay and the conventional LJ culture proportion method in order to assess the PhaB assay. Results The optimal infection time of mycobacteriophage prior to addition of virucide was between 3 and 4 h. Four percent FAS (ferrous ammonium sulphate) could inactive 10 9 PFU (plaque-forming unit) in five minutes. The samples were positive when it included 80 and 100 CFU of M. tuberculosis. However, only six NTM isolates might appear few plaques when CFU ≥ 10 6 , other NTM and all the common bacteria isolates were negative. The sensitivity was 100%, specificity was 77% and accuracy was 92.3%. TABREF85.text: M.SMEGMATIS VACCINE, A PREVENTIVE VACCINE AGAINST HIGH RISK PEOPLE OF TUBERCULOSISMIAO XU, BAOWEN CHEN, XIAOBING SHEN, CHENG SU, GUOZHI WANG Division of Bacteria Vaccines, National Institute for the Control of Pharmaceutical and Biological Products, Beijing, ChinaBackground Besides BCG prevention in health people and DOTs therapy in patients, a new strategy to control tuberculosis is put forward. Methods The pharmacology and toxicology studies were made by different animal models which include the immune hypofunction, normal and immune heperfunction animals. Results In the prophylactic effect study of M.smegmatis vaccine, after being infected with powerful M.tuberculosis, the pathological changes and bacteria load in guineapigs treated with M.smegmatis vaccine were much minor than these in control guineapigs (The pathological changes and logarithm of the number of M.tuberculosis separated from spleens of guinea-pigs with M.smegmatis vaccine treatment were 27.5 ± 12.0 and 3.98 ± 0.65, and these of control guinea-pigs were 64.6 ± 21.0 and 4.69 ± 0.67. TABREF90.text: EFFECTIVENESS OF POSTOPERATIVE RADIOTHERAPY FORMASAOKA STAGE II THYMOMA SATOSHI SONOBE 1 , HIDEAKI MIYAMOTO 1 , HIROSHI IZUMI 1 , TOSHIRO FUTAGAWA 1 , AKIO YAMAZAKI 1 , TUMIN OH 1 , BUNSEI NOBUKAWA 2 ,TOSHIMASA UEKUSA 2 , KOIHI SUDA 2 , YOSHINOSUKE FUKUTI 3 Departments of1 General Thoracic Surgery and 2 Pathology (I) and3  Respiratory Medicine Juntendo University School of Medicine, Tokyo, Japan Background Although postoperative radiotherapy is the standard treatment for Masaoka stage II thymoma, its effectiveness remains controversial. In the present study, we retrospectively compared patients receiving postoperative radiotherapy for stage II thymoma with patients who did not receive it in terms of their survival rate and relapse-free rate. The effectiveness of postoperative radiotherapy for Masaoka stage II thymoma was investigated. Methods Twenty-nine patients underwent resection of Masaoka stage II thymoma among 97 patients treated for thymoma between October 1983 and February 2002 at Juntendo University School of Medicine. They were from 25 to 76 years old (mean: 48.5 years). The patients were divided into groups with or without postoperative radiotherapy. The survival rate and relapse-free rate were retrospectively compared. Results Seven of the 29 patients died and 4 suffered relapse. Among the 14 patients given postoperative radiotherapy (total dose of 15.4-50.4 Gy, mean: 43.0 Gy), 100%, 83.3%, and 33.3% were alive at 5, 10, and 15 years after surgery, respectively, with relapse-free rates of 100%, 100%, and 50%. For the 15 patients without postoperative radiotherapy, the 5-, 10-, and 15-year survival rates were 91.7%, 76.4%, and 76.4%, respectively, with relapse-free rates of 88.9%, 88.9%, and 44.4%. The patients with and without radiotherapy showed no significant differences of overall survival and relapse-free survival (P = 0.7128 and P = 0.6526, respectively). Conclusions For Masaoka stage II thymoma, the outcome and postoperative course were not significantly influenced by postoperative radiotherapy.THE DECLINE IN FORCED EXPIRATORY VOLUME IN ONE SECONDIN CLINICALLY HEALTHY JAPANESE NON-SMOKING WOMEN: A LONGITUDINAL STUDY M NISHITSUJI, M FUJIMURA, Y ORIBE, T KITA, S MYOU, M YASUI, K KASAHARA, S NAKAO Department of Respiratory Medicine, Kanazawa University School of Medicine, JapanBackground Many studies have reported that FEV 1 is decreasing with aging. But little is known about the rate of decline of FEV 1 in Japanese women. We evaluated the longitudinal changes in lung function and the factors associated with FEV 1 changes over time in Japanese female. Methods FEV 1 measures were recorded in 1696 Japanese non-smoking female who took annually medical check involving pulmonary function test from 1995 to 2001.ResultsThe mean values ± standard deviations of annual decrease in FEV 1 (slope) were 19.6 ± 30.8 mL/year in non-smokers. Multiple regression analysis revealed that initial age, height, and FEV 1 were significant parameters determining the slope. Conclusion This study clearly showed the aging-related longitudinal decline in pulmonary function in Japanese non-smoking women.ANALYSIS OF 198 CASES WITH SARCOIDOSISHAI-QING CHU, HUIPING LI, GUOJUN HERespiratory department, Shanghai Pulmonary Hospital, Shanghai 200433, ChinaObject To know about the clinical features, the changes in radiography, the pathological findings of sarcoidosis and its diagnosis and treatment through cases analysis. Method Analysis 198 patients with confirmed sarcoidosis involved from 1980 and their clinical, radiographic, pathological features and treatment retrospectively. Result (1) There were 125 female patients (63.1%) and 73 male patients (36.9%) with the average age of 40.17 ± 5.28 years old. The duration of disease was 0.12-7.41 years and stage evaluation showed that there were 3, 86, 91 and 18 cases respective from stage 0 to stage 3. (2) Seventy cases (35.4%) were found asymptomaticly by the physical examination, while other 128 patients (64.6%) complained of various symptoms such as cough, breathless, fever, chest pain. The main extrapulmonary manifestation was superficial lymph node enlargement, eyesight faintness, and skin sarcoidosis. (3) The most often seen presentation of the chest X-ray and CT was hilar and/or mediastinal lymph node enlargement accompanying with bilateral diffusion lesion or not. Among the various biopsy means, mediastinoscopy lymph node biopsy is the most valuable, and the superficial lymph node, skin nodus, bronchial mucous and transbronchial lung biopsy are worth popularizing. The prognosis is good after accepting corticosteroids treatment, among the followed-up 63 cases, only 15 (23.8%) cases relapsed in 2 years. Conclusion It should be alert to sarcoidosis when the followings happen: middle age or the young female patient; mild respiratory tract symptoms accompanying with superficial lymph node enlargement or skin, eye involved; long duration of the disease; bilateral lung diffusion lesion in radiographic present accompanying with or without hilar, mediastinal lymphadenopathy. To avoid failing to diagnose or mistake diagnosis, we should try our best to confirm the diagnosis through the tissue pathological examination, and the corticosteroid is needed when there have the treatment indication. Once confirmed, the patient should have a long time continuous observation, follow-up periodically and be alert relapsing.A REPORT OF NINETEEN CHINESE PATIENTS WITH DIFFUSE PANBRONCHIOLITISHP LI, HQ CHU, X LI, H YU, L ZHAO, GJ HE Department of Respiratory Diseases, Shanghai Pulmonary Hospital, P. R. ChinaBackground Diffuse panbronchiolitis (DPB) is well characterized in Japanese and reported most number of cases by them around the world. Methods Nineteen Chinese patients (thirteen of male and six of female, mean age 52 ± 12 years) who administrated Shanghai Pulmonary Hospital between July 1 of 2001 and July 20 of 2004 and fulfilled the diagnostic criteria for DPB were assessed retrospectively for their clinical, radiological, arterial gas analysis, lung function, microbiological, response of the therapy, prognosis and other characteristics. Results All subjects presented with chronic cough and eighteen of them (94.7%) with copious purulent sputum production; seventeen of them (89.5%) had dyspnea on exertion. Conclusion Our data suggested that there are actually some DPB patients hided in the cohort of chronic bronchitis, bronchiectasis and other pulmonary diseases. Chinese doctors have to improve the understanding of DPB and increase our diagnosis level.Background Comprising half of the world's population and 1.2 billion (57% of global) smokers, Asia-Pacific; consisting of the World Health Organisation (WHO) regions of South East (SE) Asia and Western Pacific includes countries with the highest smoking prevalence, tobacco production and consumption, and 1.7 million smoking attributable deaths. We aim to look at recent tobacco trends and control across the region. Method The most recent data from Asia-Pacific countries and member states including population, real gross domestic product (GDP), smoking prevalence, tobacco economy, smoking attributable deaths and tobacco control measures were obtained from the second edition of Tobacco Control Country Profiles. Analyses were performed using T-test and Pearson correlation statistics. Results Of the forty countries and member states reviewed, smoking prevalence was inversely related to both GDP and sponsorship regulations (P < 0.05). Whilst developing countries had significantly higher male and overall smoking prevalence, developed countries consumed significantly more cigarettes per capita and had higher male smoking-related cancer mortality (P < 0.05). Lower male smoking prevalence was associated with greater tobacco sales regulation (P < 0.05). Female smoking prevalence correlated with smoking-attributed cardiovascular (P < 0.01) and respiratory mortality (P < 0.05), and was significantly higher in Western Pacific countries compared with SE Asian counterparts (P < 0.05). Conclusion Despite vigorous efforts in tobacco control, smoking prevalence remains high in the region. Smoking-related mortality has risen notwithstanding a decrease in per capita consumption over the recent five years, suggesting a continuous adverse health impact of tobacco. With the effecting of the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control, tobacco surveillance still poses a health challenge to the region, requiring long-term political commitment to more vigilance in regulatory infrastructure and legislation.STAPLE LINE REINFORCEMENT AND WRAPPING WITH BIOABSORBABLE FELT TO REDUCE THE AIR LEAKAGE AFTER THORACOSCOPIC SURGERYY KITA 1 , H NOGIMURA 1 , Y OZAWA, M KATO, H HASEGAWA, K NAKAIZUMI, K SUZUKI 2 , T KAZUI 2 Department of Respirology and 1 Thoracic Surgery, Haibara General Hospital, Shizuoka, 2 First Department of Surgery, Hamamatsu University School of Medicine, Hamamatsu, JapanBackground To reduce the postoperative prolonged air leaks and recurrence of pneumothorax, staple-line reinforcement is often needed for the patients, such as severe pneumothorax with emphysema or interstitial pneumonia. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of sutureline wrapping method with polyglycolic acid (PGA) felt for lung resection by video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS). Methods PGA felt wrapping procedures were as follows. Results The average of postoperative drainage period was 1.6 days in group A (range 1 to 4), and 1.9 days in group B (range 1 to 8). The rate of prolonged air leaks (more than or equal to 5 days) was 0% in group A, and 10.0% (2 cases) in group B. One case in group B was needed re-operation for air leakage. Patients treated PGA felt had shorter periods of postoperative drainage. The recurrence rate was 0% in group A, and 5% (1 case) in group B. It was also lower in group A. There was no other postoperative complication and no mortality. Conclusions VATS with PGA felt and MINO is a safe and useful method that may reduce the postoperative chest drainage periods and the recurrence of pneumothorax.CHEST RADIOGRAPHS IN ACUTE PULMONARY EMBOLISM: AN EXPERIENCE AT A TERTIARY CARE CENTRE IN PAKISTANALI BIN SARWAR ZUBAIRI, MUHAMMAD IRFAN, KULSOOM FATIMA, MUHAMMAD ATIF ZUBAIRI, SYED FAYYAZ HUSSAIN Pulmonary Section, Aga Khan University Hospital, Karachi, PakistanObjective To determine the Chest X-Ray presentation of acute pulmonary embolism (PE) in Pakistani adults presenting to a tertiary care hospital. Methods A retrospective observational study in 50 proven cases of acute pulmonary embolism on Spiral CT Scan of the Chest demonstrating an intraluminal filling defect. Hospital records of patients with a diagnosis of Acute PE were reviewed from January 2000 till March 2004. Two chest physicians independently reviewed the chest radiographs. If there was any disagreement on Chest X-ray findings, the films were reviewed by Radiologist for final interpretation. Results The risk factors for developing acute PE was present in 58% of patients. The chest radiograph were interpreted as normal in only 18% of patients with PE. The most common chest radiographic abnormalities were cardiac enlargement (46%), pulmonary parenchymal infiltrates (46%), atelectasis (32%), pleural effusion (29%), pulmonary congestion (29%), elevated hemidiaphragm (17%), pulmonary artery enlargement (17%), and oligemia (the Westermark sign 10%). Conclusions Cardiomegaly is the most common chest radiographic abnormality associated with acute pulmonary embolism. Our findings are consistent with findings reported from developed countries. Although chest radiographs are essential in the investigation of suspected PE, their main value is to exclude diagnoses that clinically mimic PE.CLINICAL CHARACTERISTICS AND OUTCOME OF PATIENTS WITH ACUTE PULMONARY EMBOLISM FROMA DEVELOPING COUNTRY ALI BIN SARWAR ZUBAIRI, MUHAMMAD IRFAN, KULSOOM FATIMA, MUHAMMAD ATIF ZUBAIRI, SYED FAYYAZ HUSSAIN Pulmonary Section, Aga Khan University Hospital, Karachi, PakistanObjective To determine the clinical profile and outcome of patients with Acute Pulmonary embolism (APE) in a developing country. Methods Descriptive study on acute pulmonary embolism proven on Spiral CT Scan demonstrating an intraluminal filling defect. Risk factors for developing APE were present in 58% of patients. The major risk factors were immobilization (34%), surgery within 3 months (26%), trauma (18%), underlying malignancy (18%), and hypercoagulable state (6%). Associated comorbidities were present in 88% of patients. Dyspnea (90%) and chest pain (32%) were the commonest symptoms. Hemoptysis and cyanosis were present in 8% and 10% patients respectively. The chest radiograph was abnormal in 82%. The most common chest radiographic abnormalities were cardiac enlargement (46%), pulmonary parenchymal infiltrates (46%) and atelectasis (32%). Echocardiography was done in 54%. Major echocardiographic abnormalities were pulmonary hypertension (59%), right ventricular hypokinesis (33%) and interventricular septal shift (22%). Mechanical ventilation was needed in 16%. Intravenous thrombolytics were given in 9% and surgical embolectomy was done in 8% of patients with massive embolism. It provides a valuable study model to evaluate the effect of drugs for respiratory diseases on pathophysiological action of airway epithelial cells.LONG-TERM CHANGE OF PULMONARY FUNCTION IN PATIENTS OF CHRONIC BERYLLIUM DISEASEWENLAN YANG, DONG ZHU, JINMING LIU Shanghai pulmonary hospital, Shanghai 200433Purpose To study the long term change of pulmonary function in patients of chronic beryllium disease (CBD). TABREF94.text: MARY S IP 1 , FANNY W KO 2 , ARTHUR CHUN-WING LAU 3 , WAI CHO YU 4 , KAM SHING TANG 5 , KAHLIN CHOO 6 , SAI ON LING 7 , JOHNNY W CHAN 8 , MOIRA CHAN-YEUNG 1 on behalf of the Hong Kong Thoracic Society Department of Medicine, 1 The University of Hong Kong, Queen Mary Hospital, 2 The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Prince of Wales Hospital, 3 Pamela Youde Nethersole Eastern Hospital, 4 The Princess Margaret Hospital, 5 Tuen Mun Hosptial, 6 Northern District Hospital, 7 Kowloon Hospital, 8 Queen Elizabeth Hospital, Hong Kong Background The accuracy of reference values of lung function is important for assessment of severity and functional impairment of respiratory diseases. Lung function varies with ethnicity and may also change over time with changes in environmental factors affecting lung development. The aim of the study was to establish update prediction formulae of spirometric parameters for Hong Kong Chinese and to compare the reference values with those derived from other studies on Caucasians and Chinese. Methods Subjects were recruited by random digit dialing, and 70% of respondents who fulfilled recruitment criteria participated. Spirometry was performed according to American Thoracic Society recommendations and the technique was standardized among the eight participating lung function laboratories. Results Evaluable data was obtained from 1089 (494 males and 595 females) healthy non-smokers aged 18 to 80 years. Age and height were found to be the major determinants of spirometric values with a linear decline of height-adjusted values of FEV 1 and FVC with age in both sexes. Spirometric values of this population have increased compared to Chinese populations of similar sex, age and height two decades ago. Reference values based on recommended adjustments of data derived from Caucasian populations overestimated the predicted spirometric parameters by about 5-19%. Conclusion Our findings underscore the need to use reference values based on updated data derived from local populations or those matched for ethnicity and other demographic characteristics. (Supported by a Research Grant from the Pneumoconiosis Compensation Fund Board, Hong Kong, and academic input from the Executive Committee, Hong Kong and Macau Chapter, American College of Chest Physicians.)COUGH PROVOCATION TEST BY CAPSAICIN INHALATION AND ITS SAFETY IN CHINESE PEOPLERC CHEN, KF LAI, W LUO, CL LIU, JP ZHENG, NS ZHONG Guangzhou Institute of Respiratory Diseases, Guangzhou, ChinaBackground Capsaicin provocation test can be used to measure cough receptors sensitivity. This study is to apply capsaicin provocation test by dosimeter method and assess its safety in Chinese people for the first time. Methods Capsaicin inhalation cough challenge test by dosimeter method was performed on 56 healthy volunteers, 11 subjects with upper respiratory infection (URI), 10 patients with eosinophilic bronchitis (EB) and 10 patients with asthma. Each subject inhaled progressively doubling concentrations of capsaicin (0.98 ~1000 mmol/L) by a breath-activated dosimeter until the concentration inducing five or more coughs (C5) was reached. The LogC5 was calculated as the cough receptors sensitivity. General lung ventilation and impedance with impulse oscillometry (ISO) were measured before and follow cough provocation test. Results There was no serious uncomfortable complaint about the test in all subjects, while 2 subjects (2.3%) complained about slight nausea and 1 subject (1.1%) felt heartburned and 1 subject (1.1%) was hoarse. Indexes of ventilation (FEV 1 , FVC, FEV 1 /FVC, MMEF) and impedance (Zrs, Fres, R5, R20, R5-R20, X5) didn't significantly change after the cough provocation test in each group. The mean LogC5 value in subjects with EB (1.59 ± 0.71) was significantly lower than normal subjects (2.52 ± 0.37, P < 0.01), URI (2.51 ± 0.66, P < 0.05) and asthma (2.34 ± 0.56, P < 0.05). Conclusion Capsaicin inhalation cough provocation test by dosimeter method is a safe and specific tool for measuring cough receptors sensitivity.(Supported by the Key Project Foundation of Guangzhou Science and Technology Bureau, No. 2002Z2-E0091.) China, 2 Division of Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine, Dept. of Medicine, and Dept. of Biological Chemistry, Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine, USABackground While focused on regulatory mechanisms of AQP1 we found unexpectedly that Staphylococcus aureus (S. aureus) can induce AQP1 expression of Balb/C fibroblast. It has been found that extracellular signalregulated kinases (ERK) was activated by some pathogens. So we want to know if ERK signal pathway involve in AQP1 induction induced by S. aureus. Methods We examined the effects of bacteria infection with S. aureus on expression of AQP1 in Balb/C fibroblasts natively expressing AQP1. Inoculation of fibroblasts cultures with 1 ¥ 10 10 S. aureus. Immunoblots of cell lysates were probed for the activated forms of the ERK, JNK and p38 MAP kinases at intervals following inoculation of fibroblasts with S. aureus. Pretreatment of the cells with the MEK1/2 inhibitors PD98059 or U0126. Results Inoculation of fibroblast cultures with S. aureus produced up to a nine-fold increase in AQP1 protein expression within 6 hours. ERK was selectively activated in Balb/C fibroblasts within 15 minutes of exposure to bacteria. ERK activation by S. aureus could be inhibited by pretreatment of the cells with PD98059 or U0126. These agents also blocked AQP1 induction in this model. Conclusion ERK activation is a necessary signal step in AQP1 induction of Balb/C fibroblast induced by S. aureus. TABREF100.text: YINGMIN WANG, DONG ZHU, JINGMING LIU Pulmonary Function Test Lab, Shanghai Pulmonary Hospital, Shanghai 200433, ChinaObjective To investigate the dynamic change of pulmonary function test including spirometric and diffusion capacity in patients with phosgene poisoning. Methods the spirometric and diffusion capacity were performed, diffusion capacity including diffusion capacity for carbon monoxide (DLCO), membrane diffusion capacity (Dm) and pulmonary capillary blood volume (Vc) in one case of phosgene poisoning both immediate after the seal of poisoning event and one year later. Results At first test immediate after the seal, the VC was 2.57 L (69%pred), FVC 2.09 L (56%pred), FEV 1.0 1.57 L (51%pred), FEV 1.0 / FVC 75%, RV 2.81 L (54%pred), MVV 69 L/min (52%pred). It showed mixed moderate decreasing of spirometry test, while DLCO was normal with the value of 21.9 ml/mmHg/min (101%pred). After one year of the poisoning event, the pulmonary function test showed VC 4.50 L (124%pred), FVC 4.10 L (115%pred), FEV 1.0 2.85 L, (92%pred), FEV1.0 /FVC 70%, RV 1.76 L (96%pred), MVV 99 L/min (101%pred). VC, FVC, FEV 1.0 and MVV increased significantly compared to the first test. Whereas FVC declined slightly. Moreover DLCO improved slightly with the value of 24.8 ml/mmHg/min (116%pred). The Dm significantly decreased with the value of 33.5 ml/mmHg/min compared with the health controls in our Lab (64.44 ± 11.84 ml/min/mmHg). However Vc apparently increased with the value 124 ml compared with the health control (71.19 ± 17.84 ml). Conclusions The spirometric test and DLCO may revert to normal after one year of phosgene poisoning, however the Dm may remain impaired. back_matter.text: Background Adiponectin (AN), one of adipocyte-secreted protein, has a unique feature about fat metabolism and body weight. It is well known that the blood levels of AN in healthy subjects are higher than those in obese subjects. Weight loss in patients with chronic respiratory failure (CRF) is a major complication, and is an important determinant of the survival prognosis. Therefore, we hypothesized that the blood levels of AN might be further higher than in healthy subjects, and that it might play a role for body weight loss. Methods In 11 subjects with CRF (male: female = 3 : 8, Age: 52.8 ± 9.7 years). The body composition analysis using bioelectrical impedance analysis (In Body®), biochemical measurements of the blood, and pulmonary function tests were performed. AN was assayed by validated sandwich ELISA using an adiponectin-specific monoclonal and polyclonal antibody. Insulin resistance was calculated by the homeostasis assessment (HOMA-R). All the subjects were clinically stable at the time point of those measurements. Results AN concentration is negatively correlated with body mass index (BMI) and fat mass (P < 0.05), but not with body fat mass, insulin resistance, or any parameters of lung functions. The patients with extremely high AN level had low levels of BMI. Conclusion Adiponectin is a candidate for one of major contributors of weight loss in patients with chronic respiratory failure. Background Pulmonary alveolar microlithiasis (PAM) is a rare disease characterized by widespread laminated calcispherites in alveolar spaces in the absence of any known disorder of calcium metabolism. Although the pathogenesis is unknown, one possibility is that it is an inborn error of metabolism, and thus is regarded as a hereditary lung disease. In presumption of autosomal recessive trait we are trying to clone the responsible gene for the disease. Method Genomic DNA from patients who suffered from PAM and consanguineous marriage in their family tree were analyzed by SNP chips obtained from Affymetrix.

GeneChip analysis of the first patient showed stretches of homozygous SNP sites that covers 1/8 of whole genome when added up. These homozygous stretches are generated as a result of consanguineous marriage, and are considered to candidate regions that harbor the responsible gene for PAM. We are analyzing the 2nd and the 3rd case by the GeneChip. By combining the results, the length of the candidate regions could be shortened geometrically, and 3 cases will be enough for picking up less that 100 genes that will be thoroughly searched for their mutations. Background Respiratory diseases may cause considerable disability in the elderly because of their limited respiratory reserve related to ageing. This study aims to study the prevalence of respiratory symptoms and diseases in the elderly Chinese in Hong Kong. Methods A telephone survey was conducted by random household telephone interview from November to December, 2003. Subjects with age ≥70 years were asked to complete a respiratory questionnaire 1 . Subjects were subsequently invited to undergo lung function (spirometry, bronchial challenge) and skin prick tests. Results 1522 subjects (697 male and 823 female) completed the telephone interview. The mean age was 76.4 ± 5.6 years old with 71.1%, 17.2% and 11.7% being non-smokers, ex-smokers and current smokers respectively. At lease one respiratory symptom was identified in 673 (44.2%) subjects. The most frequently reported symptoms were morning phlegm (33.9%), breathless at rest during the day (12.3%) and wheeze over the past 12 months (12.2%). Of the self-reported respiratory diseases, 2.8%, 5.7%, 7.7% and 3.1% had history of tuberculosis, asthma, chronic bronchitis and emphysema respectively. Of the 174 subjects with asthma, chronic bronchitis or emphysema, 96 (55.2%) had sought medical advice in the past 12 months. Among the 153 subjects who had undergone lung function testing, 17 and 13 subjects had FEV1 <80% and <70% predicted respectively. Positive bronchial challenge and skin prick test were identified in 14.3% and 19.6% of subjects respectively. Conclusion Respiratory symptoms, chronic respiratory diseases, bronchial hyperresponsiveness and skin atopy were common among Hong Kong elderlies. (This study is supported by the Hong Kong Lung Foundation Grant.)

Objective To investigate the expression and activation of mitogenactivated protein kinase (MAPK) and the relation with inflammation mediator production in the lung of rat with acute lung injury (ALI), and further to explore the role for MAPK signal transduction system in ALI. Method The murine model of ALI was estabalished by the method of 'two hit', instillation of little acid and subsequent lipopolysaccharide into lungs. Immunohistochemical techniques was uesd to detect the expressions of Raf-1, MEK-1, Extracellular signal-regulated kinase (ERK), phosphorylated-ERK (P-ERK) and iNOS, TNF-a, and compare them with control group. Results In the experimental rat lungs, MEK-1, ERK and P-ERK were intensively expressed, but Raf-1 expression was relatively weak. In addition to their expression, the stronger expression of iNOS and TNF-a were seen in the same lung area. Nevertheless, only the minimal exprssions of these kinases were detected in normal control lungs and few cells showed immunoreactivity staining, especially Raf-1 and P-ERK. The control lung expressed lower levels of iNOS and TNF-a than ALI. Significant differences were noted in the experimental and control groups (P < 0.05). Conclusion Raf-1 to MEK-1 to MAPK signal transduction system were activated in the lungs of ALI rat, with the elevated expression of inflammatory mediator NO, TNF-a. The activation of Raf-1 to MEK1-1 to MAPK could lead to the activation of polymorphonuclear neutrophile and macrophage which synthesised and secreted NO, TNF-a.

back_matter.text: Objective This study used a model of pulmonary thromboembolism (PTE) in rats induced by injection of thrombus to investigate the mechanism of the pulmonary vascular remodeling. Methods Male SD rats were divided averagely into PTE and sham group. PTE model was induced by injection of thrombus, and injected subcutaneouly with Tranexamic acid. Shams were no thrombus. Rats were sacrificed at the 1st, 3rd, 7th and 14th days (d). The lungs was stained by HE, Masson and PTAH. The IH stainings of MMP-9, TIMP-1 and PDGF-BB were taken. The hybridization in situ stainings of MMP-9 and TIMP-1 were made. Results Inner elastic membrane (IEM) in embolic vessel wall was destroyed and the SMCs migrated into subintimal area. The intima thicken and neointima appeared (pulmonary vascular remodeling). MMP-9, TIMP-1 and PDGF-BB were expressed in the SMCs, endothelial cells of embolic vessel and neointima in the PTEs. The expressions reached its culmination at the 3rd and 7th d respectively and became weak at the 14th d. The expression of a-SMA was seen in the cells of the neointima of the embolic vessel. Conclusion PTE could lead to the hyperplasia of endothelial cells, the destruction of IEM. SMCs migrate into the subintimal area and cause the occurrence of neointima and vascular remodeling. The lopsided development of MMP-9/TIMP-1 involve in the pulmonary vascular remodeling associated with PTE.
